section.para: The Paper Instruments function allows funds transfer to be performed by methods other than Electronic Funds Transfer, where the Payer and the Beneficiary accounts are held by separate banks. These options allow for older methods of authorisation to be used, such as Cashier Orders, Demand Drafts and Cheques. Requests are made to the banks by the drawer, to raise the requested Paper Instruments and send them to the Beneficiary.

section.title: Paper Instruments - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Paper Instruments function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Paper Instruments.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, there may be a link to the Paper Instruments function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Paper Instruments - Options
section.para: The Paper Instruments function allows access to the Fund Transfer module provided by Cash Portal. After selecting Cash Services > Paper Instruments from the toolbar, a number of options are provided for Paper Instruments in the left side navigation menu.
The following options are available for Paper Instruments

listitem.para: Create a new Cashier Order for payment to a beneficiary.
Create a new Demand Draft for payment to a beneficiary.
Create a new Cashier Order or Demand Draft from an existing template.
Create a new Cashier Order or Demand Draft from an existing record.
Review, complete and submit records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Paper Instruments page, the system requests Entity and account details that the cashier order is to be drawn from.

section.title: Paper Instruments - From Template
section.para: When creating a new Cashiers Order or Demand Draft, a previously saved template can be used to pre-populate common fields of the appropriate form. Templates need to have been created at an earlier stage for them to be used (see Cashier Order form - Action Buttons or Demand Draft form - Action Buttons for more information on creating templates.)

The "From Template" option allows a previously created template to be used as a basis for a order or draft. To use the template, select this option from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Paper Instruments page, to display a list of existing templates.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Reference, Entity or Description field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of templates are described as follows:
Field
Description
Reference
Template name
Entity
Entity the template is associated with.
Description
A description of the template
Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the right of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Click to open the template in edit mode and change its details
Click to delete the template.

section.para: Select a template by clicking on the Reference field of the required entry.
Complete or change the required fields in the rest of the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: Paper Instruments - Copy From
section.para: Select this option from the side navigation menu, to create a new Cashiers Order or Demand Draft, using an existing one as a model. When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Paper Instruments page, a list of existing orders and drafts will be displayed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity or Ccy field. To display all orders and drafts, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked.

The columns returned in the list of transactions are described as follows:
Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when the Paper Instrument was initiated.
Entity
Entity the payment is associated with.
Ccy
The currency of the payment.
Amount
The amount of the payment.

Select an entry to copy, by clicking on the System ID field of the required entry. The standard order/draft form will be displayed, with most fields populated with values from the original request. Complete or change the required fields in the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: Paper Instruments - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Paper Instruments page, it allows a Cashier Order and Demand Draft request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of Cashier Order and Demand Draft requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Paper Instruments - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Paper Instruments page, it allows a Cashier Order and Demand Draft requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of Cashier Order and Demand Draft requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
